com.codefactory.gwt.domiterator.client
Class ClassSelector

java.lang.Object
  com.codefactory.gwt.domiterator.client.ClassSelector
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<com.google.gwt.dom.client.Element>, Iterator<com.google.gwt.dom.client.Element>
public class ClassSelector
extends Object
implements Iterable<com.google.gwt.dom.client.Element>, Iterator<com.google.gwt.dom.client.Element>

Version:
1.0.0 2009-01-22

Copyright 2009, Fred Janon - The Code Factory

Class that looks for DOM elements with the specified class name(s), optionally starting from the specified DOM element.

The search is breadth first and is case sensitive by default. It can be made case insensitive with setCaseInsensitive(boolean) The search starts with the DOM 'body' element by default when no start element is specified. The class name can be composed of several class names separated by spaces. The class name can also be blank "", the iterator will return all the elements descendants of the start element, including the start element.

This class implements the Iterator and the Iterable interfaces. It can be used in two ways: with an Iterator or as an Iterable with a Java 5 'for' loop:

    // Iterator
    ClassSelector cs = new ClassSelector("class1 class2", "element12");
//  or
//  ClassSelector cs = new ClassSelector("class1 class2", Document.get().getElementById("element12"));
    Element element = null;
    String ids = "";
    while (cs.hasNext())
        {
         element = cs.next();
         // Do something with the element with the classes "class1 class2"
         ids += element.getId();        // concatenate the ids without space
        }

    // Iterable
    for (Element element : new ClassSelector("theclassname", "div6"))
        {
         GWT.log("for in: " + element.getNodeName() + " " + element.getId(), null);
        }

Note: The code uses a Java 5 'for' loop in hasClassnames(Element, boolean).

Null pointer exception if classname or startElement are null.
Author:
Fred Janon

Constant Field Values

classname

protected String classname
The name we are looking for in the 'class' attribute of the DOM elements. Used for case sensitive searches and when only one class name is specified

classnameUppercase

protected String classnameUppercase
The name in uppercase we are looking for in the 'class' attribute of the DOM elements. Used for case insensitive searches and when only one class name is specified

startElement

protected com.google.gwt.dom.client.Element startElement
The DOM element that the search starts with. It is included in the search. If the start element has the classname(s) specified, if will be returned by the iterator

currentElement

protected com.google.gwt.dom.client.Element currentElement
Used internally has the current/last element used for the search. The search resumes from this element when next() is called

searchDone

protected boolean searchDone
Flag used internally to manage the state between hasNext() and next()

hasNext

public boolean hasNext()
Implementation of the Iterator interface

Specified by:
hasNext in interface Iterator<com.google.gwt.dom.client.Element>
Returns:
Returns true if there is another element with the specified class name(s). The first time next() is called, the start element is returned if it has the specified class names.

next

public com.google.gwt.dom.client.Element next()
Implementation of the Iterator interface

Specified by:
next in interface Iterator<com.google.gwt.dom.client.Element>
Returns:
Returns the next element with the specified class names(s) or null if we reached the end of the DOM tree under the startElement.
